page.title: 01Westwards From Rothesay
page.content: A rural area, three quarters of which is farmland and the remainder lowland heath & heather dominated rocky hill areas. The area supports 10 farms all of which are engaged in raising cattle and sheep. The cultivated areas are in the main under grass or for growing crops suitable for supplementing animal feedstuffs. A limited acreage is devoted to potatoes and grain for human requirements. The landscape undulates from the shoreline in the north west to approximately 85 metres above sea level in the south east with numerous isolated heather and gorse covered rocky outcrops up to 160 metres in height throughout. An 'A' type road bordering the west perimeter combines with a 'B' type road on the south to provide a quick and easy access to the island capital of Rothesay through which all import/
